These Fourier series converge absolutely when \Re\mu<0 , and conditionally when \nu is real and 0\leq\mu<\frac{1}{2}.

In particular, \mathsf{P}_{n}\left(\cos\theta\right)=\frac{2^{2n+2}(n!)^{2}}{\pi(2n+1)!}\* \sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\frac{1\cdot 3\cdots(2k-1)}{k!}\*\frac{(n+1)(n+2)\cdots(n+k )}{(2n+3)(2n+5)\cdots(2n+2k+1)}\*\sin\left((n+2k+1)\theta\right), , \mathsf{Q}_{n}\left(\cos\theta\right)=\frac{2^{2n+1}(n!)^{2}}{(2n+1)!}\*\sum_{ k=0}^{\infty}\frac{1\cdot 3\cdots(2k-1)}{k!}\*\frac{(n+1)(n+2)\cdots(n+k)}{(2n +3)(2n+5)\cdots(2n+2k+1)}\*\cos\left((n+2k+1)\theta\right), with conditional convergence for each.
For other trigonometric expansions see Erdélyi et al. (1953a, pp. 146–147).
